==Trivia== 
* Based on her name in Chinese, Ecate may be named after {{W|Aketi (town)|Aketi, Democratic Republic of the Congo}}.
* She may also be named after Ecatepec (Central Nahuatl: ''{{wt|Ehcatepec}}''), the {{W|Nahuatl}} word for "{{W|Ehecatl|windy}} hill."
===Etymology===
* ''Ecate'' could be derived from the {{w|Nahuatl}} word ''{{wt|ehecatl}}'' or ''{{wt|ehcatl#Classical_Nahuatl|ehcatl}}'', which means "wind."
